task.title: Alternate Units
task.shortdesc: You can create a dimension in two systems of measurement simultaneously in a drawing. This feature is helpful when you want to add feet and inches dimensions in a drawing created using metric un its. The alternative units appear in square brackets ([]) in the dimension text. Alternative units can be applied to linear dimensions only.

context.p: If you turn alternative-units dimensioning on when editing a linear dimension, the measurement is multiplied by a specified alternate scale value. This value indicates the number of alternate units per current unit of measurement. The default fault value for imperial units is 25.4, which represents that each inch is equivalent to 25.4 millimeters. The default value for metric units is 0.0394, which represents that each millimeter is equivalent to 0.0394 inches. The precision for alternate units determines the number of decimal places.
